Class Panel2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • Panel2D

  • public class Panel2D
extends java.lang.Object
    We could have many different instances of 2D char arrays that could display different graphics we design. This class encapsulates (hides) the confusion of working with the 2D char array directly elsewhere in our program.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int HEIGHT 
      static int WIDTH 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Panel2D()
      This constructor will initialize the bitmap by creating a new 2D char array of dimensions WIDTH and HEIGHT.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void circle(Point2D centre, int r)
      Move, and then draw this circle shape in the bitmap.
      void clear()
      This will fill the 2D char array with backtick ` characters (usually under the tilde ~ in the top-left corner of a keyboard).
      void display()
      Actually print the bitmap to output.
      void drawAxis()
      this method sets up our axis to be drawn using four points.
      void drawLine(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2, char stroke)
      Avoids using floating-point arithmetic for a faster drawing of a line.
      char get(int x, int y)
      This method swaps the order of the x and y values for us (so we don't have to swap them everywhere else in our code).
      void pointLabel(java.util.ArrayList<Point2D> points)
      this method allows for the labeling of each point in increasing alphabetic order.
      void set(int x, int y, char c)
      Similar to the get method, but assign a char value c to an x and y position in the bitmap.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • WIDTH

        public static final int WIDTH
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • HEIGHT

        public static final int HEIGHT
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • Panel2D

        public Panel2D()
        This constructor will initialize the bitmap by creating a new 2D char array of dimensions WIDTH and HEIGHT.

    • Method Detail

      • clear

        public void clear()
        This will fill the 2D char array with backtick ` characters (usually under the tilde ~ in the top-left corner of a keyboard). We are using backticks to help if debugging is needed, because printing spaces means we would see nothing on screen.

      • get

        public char get(int x,
                int y)
        This method swaps the order of the x and y values for us (so we don't have to swap them everywhere else in our code).
        Parameters:
        x - The horizontal position inside the bitmap.
        y - The vertical position inside the bitmap.
        Returns:
        The character stored in the (x, y) position of bitmap.

      • set

        public void set(int x,
                int y,
                char c)
        Similar to the get method, but assign a char value c to an x and y position in the bitmap.
        Parameters:
        x - The horizontal position in the bitmap.
        y - The vertical position in the bitmap.
        c - The character stored in the bitmap.

      • display

        public void display()
        Actually print the bitmap to output. The rows are printed in backward order so that the output matches the axes of the 2D plane and the index values for bitmap.

      • drawLine

        public void drawLine(int x1,
                     int y1,
                     int x2,
                     int y2,
                     char stroke)
        Avoids using floating-point arithmetic for a faster drawing of a line. Feel free to ask me about the math and why it works.
        Parameters:
        first - The start position of the straight line.
        second - The end position of the straight line.
        stroke - The character used to draw the line.

      • circle

        public void circle(Point2D centre,
                   int r)
        Move, and then draw this circle shape in the bitmap. This is Bresenham's circle-drawing algorithm, which you can read a short explanation about at GeeksForGeeks.

      • drawAxis

        public void drawAxis()
        this method sets up our axis to be drawn using four points.

      • pointLabel

        public void pointLabel(java.util.ArrayList<Point2D> points)
        this method allows for the labeling of each point in increasing alphabetic order.
        Parameters:
        points - we intend to pass in multiple points
